headshotImage.caption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Gunathilaka b Kumara 127 (142b 15x4 1x6) SR: 89.43

dismissalComment.html: another short ball, looks to muscle this over long-on but finds Gunathilaka there. This had a lot of power but he got down low, cupped both hands and allowed them to lodge safely. End of a super knock from Tamim. A tad slow initially, picked up the pace, again slowed down after the century and then again accelerated in quest for quick runs.

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Sandakan b Lakmal 72 (71b 4x4 1x6) SR: 101.4

dismissalComment.html: he's picked out short fine leg. Looked to help it over the fielder there but this was a slower deliver and he couldn't force enough pace to get it over. Shakib was starting to run away with this. Looks like he got it off the glove. Sandakan, the nervy Sandakan, manages to hang on.

headshotImage.caption: Soumya Sarkar headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Soumya Sarkar headshot

dismissalComment.html: edged, taken by the keeper. Plays across the line and perishes. It is angled in but fired from wide of the crease so it still comes on around the fifth-stump channel. Sarkar misreads the line and looks to flick it, closes the bat face early and gets a leading edge for his troubles

headshotImage.longCaption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c & b Sandakan 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: appeal for caught-and-bowled. On-field umpire is unmoved, they go upstairs to check. Low, dipping full toss on middle and the bat hits the ground before the ball is chipped off the bottom of the bat as it goes back to the bowler. The ball has not bounced or hit any part of the ground at any point. Chipped to the right of the bowler who moves fluidly and bends forward to take the catch. Big, big blow, in-form Mushfiqur has been sent back for one

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c Mahmudullah b Mustafizur Rahman 55 (35b 4x4 2x6) SR: 157.14

dismissalComment.html: looks to swing this over midwicket, but the bat face turns in his hand as he makes contact. That means there's no power behind the stroke whatsoever. Lobs high. Long-off comes in, calls for it and then takes it. Bangladesh's second win ever in ODIs in Sri Lanka.

headshotImage.longCaption: Milinda Siriwardana player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: top catch by Shuvagata Hom. Had a lot of work to do, ran nearly 20 yards to his right and then dished in a slide to pull off a low catch. Took it where deep midwicket would've been stationed. This was short, and while the intent was right, he didn't quite get hold of the pull shot.

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: simple catch at mid-on. Why would you want to be a hero when you can simply nudge the ball and enjoy the big hits from the other end? This is Mustafizur's stock delivery: a cutter that deviates a long way from length on middle, Lakmal swings leg side and toe-ends the slog to Sabbir who takes a dolly.

dismissalComment.html: holes out to long-on. Lack of runs and mounting run rate, and the pressure gets to the batsman. And full marks to the bowler as well, unafraid to toss it up. Mendis decides to take him on, comes down the track and lofts it. Not enough behind it and it goes straight down the throat of long-on

headshotImage.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Danushka Gunathilaka lbw b Mashrafe Mortaza 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: looks plumb and given. This is a serious blow for Sri Lanka, early wicket is the last thing they needed. Gunathilaka consults with his captain and asks for a review. Short of good length, angling across on middle and straightening. Beats the inside edge of the batsman and hits the front pad. No bat involved, replays confirm. Clipping the top of middle and off, just about brushing the bails, and the umpire's call remains. Sri Lanka have lost an early wicket as well as their one review

dismissalComment.html: chipped tamely to mid-on. That is a desperate shot and there is stunned silence at the ground. Short ball, looking to pull and there is no room absolutely. Does not find the middle of the bat and gets big on him as well. Ahat is the simplest of catches to the Bangladesh captain, off the splice of the bat

dismissalText.commentary: Sachith Pathirana c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 31 (32b 3x4 0x6) SR: 96.87

dismissalComment.html: as easy as they come as far as catches go. Had to go for it. Mashrafe floats an off-cutter full and wide outside off, Pathirana sees this as an opportunity to biff this over deep midwicket but didn't  have any pace to work with. Ended up skewing it straight to Mahmudullah who reverse cups one at cover. Too easy. Had too much time at one stage, and that can make fielders nervous at the best of times. Not this time though.

headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c Mahmudullah b Mustafizur Rahman 55 (35b 4x4 2x6) SR: 157.14

commentTextItems.html: looks to swing this over midwicket, but the bat face turns in his hand as he makes contact. That means there's no power behind the stroke whatsoever. Lobs high. Long-off comes in, calls for it and then takes it. Bangladesh's second win ever in ODIs in Sri Lanka.

commentPostTextItems.html: Right then. That brings to an end our coverage of this game. Bangladesh have been thoroughly clinical and deserved to win. In hindsight, probably Tharanga should have made first use of the surface as it seemed pretty good to bat on. But you cannot blame him entirely for electing to field as he had to take the dew into consideration. That apart, there is plenty for Sri Lanka to ponder about and they do not have much time as this is a three-match series and one more defeat will see them concede it. Bangladesh have picked up from right where they left off in the Tests. Another win on Tuesday will be another feather to impressive recent ODI performances. Join us then for the second ODI at the same venue. Until then, it's goodbye from us.

Mashrafe Mortaza - Obviously, it was important to win, especially when it is a three-match series, the first game becomes important. I think we played the perfect game today. If you look at our game, Tamim, Mushfiqur have all played for the last 10 years and are very experienced. If you look at the history of this ground, 250-270 would have been a par score. I think Tamim was phenomenal. Shakib also played very well and Mosaddek and Mahmudullah finished well.

Upul Tharanga - I think we controlled the middle period very well. But we bowled very badly and on the field also, we gave around 25-30 runs extra. We have to improve in all three departments. Chasing big totals, someone needs to get a big score. We lost three wickets in the first ten overs. Chasing 300, someone needs to get that big score, which we did not do today.

Tamim - I had a lot of opportunities to score fifties, but I did not convert the. But the past is past, and whenever I have the opportunity, I want to score and help the team in the process as well. Batting till the 45th over is not easy, lot of sweat goes down. We just kept our cool and kept rotating the strike. The way Shakib played was exceptional. I knew if I scored 135 or so, we could get to 300. That is what I tried to do. The heat got to me.
Tamim Iqbal is the Man of the Match for his century.

10.35pm The Bangladesh of 2015 would've jumped in joy, maybe even shouted from roof tops. But this side, who have beaten Pakistan, India, South Africa and England (well, nearly in ODIs), know they're much improved and can mount a serious challenge against the big boys regularly. What's heartening from their point of view is they've been able to sustain momentum from the win in the second Test. The architects of the win? Two of their superstars: Tamim and Shakib

At the end, you've got to wonder if Sri Lanka erred by sending Thisara in at No. 8. Could the result have been different had they sent him higher up? Probably not, but at least they could have got much closer to the target. Sri Lanka at no stage looked like chasing this down, not even when Chandimal was fighting. Plenty of thinking to do if they're to bounce back in this three-match series.

commentPreTextItems.html: direct hit from short fine leg to the bowler's end. Sandakan is in trouble

commentTextItems.html: turns this with the spin but Mustafizur is quick to swoop in on the ball and fire a throw. Sandakan took a couple of steps outside his crease and waited for some reason. Then took off again. Was a couple of yards short when the bails were broken.
top-edges a reverse sweep, safe. Just wide of short third man
slow turn, punches one to cover. Was winding up and looking to slog over midwicket
punched down to long-on, sensible stuff. Give the strike back to the big man
lunges forward and turns it with the spin to the leg side
sweet timing to flay that to deep cover. Excellent running to come back for the second

commentTextItems.html: eased into the gap between cover and point. The man from the deep took ages to get off the blocks, Shakib running backwards was also ambling towards the ball. Thisara saw the opportunity and scampered back for the second. First half-century in two and a half years for him
full toss on the pads and he brings out those powerful wrists to bisect the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
squeezed to third man off a thick edge
floated full outside off, squeezed to deep cover

flat-bats a biggie over long-on. Picked the length early and muscled it. Brute force. The ball boys there were ducking for cover. Couldn't have so easily smashed into the face of one of the kids there. He coped one on his backside instead
fired full on the pads, worked to long-on

dismissalComment.html: another short ball, looks to muscle this over long-on but finds Gunathilaka there. This had a lot of power but he got down low, cupped both hands and allowed them to lodge safely. End of a super knock from Tamim. A tad slow initially, picked up the pace, again slowed down after the century and then again accelerated in quest for quick runs.

dismissalComment.html: appeal for caught-and-bowled. On-field umpire is unmoved, they go upstairs to check. Low, dipping full toss on middle and the bat hits the ground before the ball is chipped off the bottom of the bat as it goes back to the bowler. The ball has not bounced or hit any part of the ground at any point. Chipped to the right of the bowler who moves fluidly and bends forward to take the catch. Big, big blow, in-form Mushfiqur has been sent back for one

dismissalText.commentary: Danushka Gunathilaka lbw b Mashrafe Mortaza 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: looks plumb and given. This is a serious blow for Sri Lanka, early wicket is the last thing they needed. Gunathilaka consults with his captain and asks for a review. Short of good length, angling across on middle and straightening. Beats the inside edge of the batsman and hits the front pad. No bat involved, replays confirm. Clipping the top of middle and off, just about brushing the bails, and the umpire's call remains. Sri Lanka have lost an early wicket as well as their one review

dismissalText.long: c sub (Shuvagata Hom) b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Milinda Siriwardana c sub (Shuvagata Hom) b Mustafizur Rahman 22 (25b 1x4 1x6) SR: 88

dismissalComment.html: top catch by Shuvagata Hom. Had a lot of work to do, ran nearly 20 yards to his right and then dished in a slide to pull off a low catch. Took it where deep midwicket would've been stationed. This was short, and while the intent was right, he didn't quite get hold of the pull shot.

headshotImage.longCaption: Mahmudullah headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Sachith Pathirana c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 31 (32b 3x4 0x6) SR: 96.87

dismissalComment.html: as easy as they come as far as catches go. Had to go for it. Mashrafe floats an off-cutter full and wide outside off, Pathirana sees this as an opportunity to biff this over deep midwicket but didn't  have any pace to work with. Ended up skewing it straight to Mahmudullah who reverse cups one at cover. Too easy. Had too much time at one stage, and that can make fielders nervous at the best of times. Not this time though.

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Suranga Lakmal c Sabbir Rahman b Mustafizur Rahman 8 (9b 1x4 0x6) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: simple catch at mid-on. Why would you want to be a hero when you can simply nudge the ball and enjoy the big hits from the other end? This is Mustafizur's stock delivery: a cutter that deviates a long way from length on middle, Lakmal swings leg side and toe-ends the slog to Sabbir who takes a dolly.

headshotImage.caption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: looks plumb and given. This is a serious blow for Sri Lanka, early wicket is the last thing they needed. Gunathilaka consults with his captain and asks for a review. Short of good length, angling across on middle and straightening. Beats the inside edge of the batsman and hits the front pad. No bat involved, replays confirm. Clipping the top of middle and off, just about brushing the bails, and the umpire's call remains. Sri Lanka have lost an early wicket as well as their one review

dismissalComment.html: holes out to long-on. Lack of runs and mounting run rate, and the pressure gets to the batsman. And full marks to the bowler as well, unafraid to toss it up. Mendis decides to take him on, comes down the track and lofts it. Not enough behind it and it goes straight down the throat of long-on

dismissalComment.html: gone, caught at short fine leg. Attempting a sweep shot and the ball is not full enough. Does not account for the bounce as a result and gets a top edge that lobs to short fine leg. Soumya Sarkar runs a few steps to his right and snaffles it

dismissalComment.html: chipped tamely to mid-on. That is a desperate shot and there is stunned silence at the ground. Short ball, looking to pull and there is no room absolutely.
